item.title: Bank of England cuts interest rates, in welcome Christmas boost for consumers
item.description: The Bank of England voted to cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75% in its last monetary policy move of 2025.

item.title: November's inflation report is the first to be released after the shutdown. Here's what to expect
item.description: November's CPI report is expected to show the annual inflation rate at 3.1%, according to economists polled by Dow Jones.

item.title: Watch Fed Governor Christopher Waller speak on interest rates and the race to succeed Powell
item.description: Waller is one of the five finalists considered for to replace Fed Chairman Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

item.title: Hassett says Fed independence is ‘really important’ and chair candidates shouldn’t be disqualified for being Trump’s friend
item.description: Hassett declined in a CNBC interview to directly address his own candidacy but said forging consensus is an important part of the job.

item.title: Payrolls rose by 64,000 in November after falling by 105,000 in October, delayed jobs numbers show
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 45,000 in November as the unemployment rate rose to 4.5%.
